🏛 1. Taj Mahal

Location: Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India Built: Construction started in 1632, completed in 1653 Built by: Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal Architecture: Made of white marble, a blend of Persian, Turkish, and Indian styles Significance: One of the Seven Wonders of the World and a UNESCO World Heritage Site


🏯 2. Red Fort (Lal Qila)

Location: Delhi, India Built: 1638–1648 Built by: Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan when he shifted the capital from Agra to Delhi Material: Red sandstone Significance: Symbol of Mughal power and grandeur Every year, on 15th August (Independence Day), the Prime Minister of India hoists the national flag here Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2007


🏺 3. Harappa Civilization (Indus Valley Civilization)

Period: Around 3300 BCE – 1300 BCE Location: Present-day Pakistan and northwest India (Indus River Valley) Main Cities: Harappa and Mohenjo-daro Features: Well-planned cities with drainage system, brick houses, granaries, wells Developed trade, agriculture, and crafts Used the Harappan Script (still undeciphered) Decline: Around 1500 BCE due to floods, climate change, or Aryan migration
